title: John-Patrick Strauß
text:
John-Patrick Strauß (born 28 January 1996) is a German-born Filipino professional <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> for German club <a href="FC%20Erzgebirge%20Aue">Erzgebirge Aue</a> and the <a href="Philippines%20national%20football%20team">Philippines national team</a>.
Career.
Youth.
Born in <a href="Wetzlar">Wetzlar, Germany</a>, Strauß had his youth career at FC Cleeberg, TSG Wieseck and <a href="RB%20Leipzig">RB Leipzig</a>.
RB Leipzig II.
On 2016, after playing for the U17 and U19 team of Leipzig, Strauß was promoted to the second team.
Erzgebirge Aue.
On 2017, Strauß signed a three-year contract with <a href="2.%20Bundesliga">2. Bundesliga</a> club <a href="FC%20Erzgebirge%20Aue">Erzgebirge Aue</a>, he joined the club on a free transfer.
International career.
Strauß was born to a German father and a Filipino mother that made him eligible to play for <a href="Germany%20national%20football%20team">Germany</a> and the <a href="Philippines%20national%20football%20team">Philippines</a>.
In September 2018, Strauß received a call-up from the <a href="Philippines%20national%20football%20team">Philippines</a> for a national team training camp and a friendly game against <a href="Bahrain%20national%20football%20team">Bahrain</a>.
On 13 October 2018, Strauß received his first cap for the Philippines in a friendly match against <a href="Oman%20national%20football%20team">Oman</a>, he came in as a substitute replacing <a href="Martin%20Steuble">Martin Steuble</a> in the 67th minute of the match.
